title: 'There is always a better Samurai round the corner': Eddie Jones challenges England to get even better for World Cup semi-final with All Blacks
text:
Eddie Jones has challenged his players to ‘become even better Samurai,’ after a record-equalling 40-16 win over Australia sent them on their way to a showdown with New Zealand in Yokohama on Saturday. The All Blacks thrashed Ireland 46-14 at the Tokyo Stadium.

It was a sparky, gutsy display from England, defending hard against big Wallaby runners before pulling clear but Jones believes that there is more to come if they are to go one better than that last time they met New Zealand in a World Cup semi-final in 1995 in Cape Town when Jonah Lomu trampled on their dreams as well as on a few of their players.

“The best Samurai are those who had a plan but who could adapt,” said Jones. “They are...
description: Eddie Jones has challenged his players to ‘become even better Samurai,’ after a record-equalling 40-16 win over Australia sent them on their way to a showdown with New Zealand in Yokohama on Saturday.
